de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.utilities.scaling.outlier

Class OutlierMinusLogScaling

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.utilities.scaling.outlier.OutlierMinusLogScaling
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OutlierScalingFunction, ScalingFunction

    @Reference(authors="H.-P. Kriegel, P. Kr\u00f6ger, E. Schubert, A. Zimek",
           title="Interpreting and Unifying Outlier Scores",
           booktitle="Proc. 11th SIAM International Conference on Data Mining (SDM), Mesa, AZ, 2011",
           url="http://dx.doi.org/10.1137/1.9781611972818.2")
public class OutlierMinusLogScaling
extends Object
implements OutlierScalingFunction
    Scaling function to invert values by computing -1 * Math.log(x) Useful for example for scaling ABOD, but see MinusLogStandardDeviationScaling and MinusLogGammaScaling for more advanced scalings for this algorithm. Reference:

    H.-P. Kriegel, P. Kr√∂ger, E. Schubert, A. Zimek
    Interpreting and Unifying Outlier Scores
    Proc. 11th SIAM International Conference on Data Mining (SDM), Mesa, AZ, 2011

    Since:
    0.3
    Author:
    Erich Schubert

      • prepare

        public void prepare(OutlierResult or)
        Description copied from interface: OutlierScalingFunction
        Prepare is called once for each data set, before getScaled() will be called. This function can be used to extract global parameters such as means, minimums or maximums from the outlier scores.
        Specified by:
        prepare in interface OutlierScalingFunction
        Parameters:
        or - Outlier result to use

      • prepare

        public <A> void prepare(A array,
               NumberArrayAdapter<?,A> adapter)
        Description copied from interface: OutlierScalingFunction
        Prepare is called once for each data set, before getScaled() will be called. This function can be used to extract global parameters such as means, minimums or maximums from the score array. The method using a full OutlierResult is preferred, as it will allow access to the metadata.
        Specified by:
        prepare in interface OutlierScalingFunction
        Parameters:
        array - Data to process
        adapter - Array adapter
